solution_line_template: To avoid interest she'll make payments for {years} years. There are {months_per_year} months in 1 year so that's {years}*{months_per_year} = <<{years}*{months_per_year}={total_months}>>{total_months} months

Each monthly payment is ${monthly_payment} and she'll pay that for {total_months} months for a total of {monthly_payment}*{total_months} = $<<{monthly_payment}*{total_months}={total_payments}>>{total_payments}

She also put ${down_payment} down as a down payment and her monthly payments came out to ${total_payments} so her loan was for {down_payment}+{total_payments} = $<<{down_payment}+{total_payments}={loan_amount}>>{loan_amount}
